target.expr: (node_boot_time_seconds{location="$location", node=~"$pod_nodes"} offset $__interval unless node_boot_time_seconds{location="$location", node=~"$pod_nodes"}) unless (changes(node_boot_time_seconds{location="$location", node=~"$pod_nodes"}[$__interval]) > 0)

targets.expr:
max by(pod, uid, node, host_network) (
  # if we show entries for pods without IP, when pod gets an IP there will be duplicate entries
  last_over_time(kube_pod_info{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__range])
) * on(pod, uid) group_left(workload_type, workload)
max by(pod, uid, workload_type, workload) (
  last_over_time(namespace_workload_pod:kube_pod_owner:relabel{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid!=""}[$__range])
)

max by(pod, uid) (
  # when pod name is the same (for example, for static pods, like kube-apiserver)
  # sometimes kube-state-metrics updates only UID, while still keeping old container_id
  # which leads to many-to-one matching in join queries like this one
  # topk(count_over_time) ensures that we pick metrics that were present for the longest interval
  topk by(namespace, pod, container, name) (1, label_replace((
    count_over_time(kube_pod_container_info{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", container_id!=""}[$__range])
    or
    count_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_info{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", container_id!=""}[$__range])
  ), "name", "$1", "container_id", "containerd://(.*)")) * 0
  + on(namespace, pod, container, name) group_right(uid)
  max without(uid) (max_over_time(container_last_seen{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__range]))
) * 1000

(
  min by(pod, uid) (
    # when pod name is the same (for example, for static pods, like kube-apiserver)
    # sometimes kube-state-metrics updates only UID, while still keeping old container_id
    # which leads to many-to-one matching in join queries like this one
    # topk(count_over_time) ensures that we pick metrics that were present for the longest interval
    topk by(namespace, pod, container, name) (1, label_replace((
      count_over_time(kube_pod_container_info{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", container_id!=""}[$__range])
      or
      count_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_info{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", container_id!=""}[$__range])
    ), "name", "$1", "container_id", "containerd://(.*)")) * 0
    + on(namespace, pod, container, name) group_right(uid)
    min by(namespace, pod, container, name) (
      (
        timestamp(container_last_seen{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"})
        -
        last_over_time(container_last_seen{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[1m])
      )
      or
      (time() - max_over_time(container_last_seen{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__range]))
    )
  )
  or
  # when no container_last_seen_time exist for selected pod, fall back to pod creation time
  max by(pod, uid) (time() - max_over_time(kube_pod_created{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__range]))
)

min by(pod) (
    (max_over_time(kube_pod_status_phase{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", phase="Failed"}[$__interval]) == 1) * 2
    or
    (max_over_time(kube_pod_status_phase{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", phase="Succeeded"}[$__interval]) == 1) * 3
    or
    (max_over_time(kube_pod_status_phase{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", phase="Pending"}[$__interval]) == 1) * 4
    or
    (
        max_over_time(kube_pod_status_phase{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", phase="Running"}[$__interval]) == 1
        and on(namespace, pod, uid)
        min_over_time(kube_pod_status_ready{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", condition="true"}[$__interval]) == 1
    ) * 5
    or
    (
        max_over_time(kube_pod_status_phase{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", phase="Running"}[$__interval]) == 1
        and on(namespace, pod, uid)
        min_over_time(kube_pod_status_ready{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", condition="true"}[$__interval]) == 0
    ) * 6
    or
    (max_over_time(kube_pod_status_phase{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", phase="Unknown"}[$__interval]) == 1) * 7
    or
    # when no condition above satisfied, use this as a fallback
    (max_over_time(kube_pod_status_phase{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", phase="Unknown"}[$__interval]) * 0 + 8)
)

max by(pod, uid) (
  last_over_time(kube_pod_info{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__interval])
)
or on()
(
  vector(0) unless on() last_over_time(kube_pod_info{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__interval])
)

max by(pod, node) (
  last_over_time(kube_pod_info{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__interval])
)
or on()
(
  vector(0) unless on() last_over_time(kube_pod_info{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__interval])
)
max by(pod) (max_over_time(kube_pod_created{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__interval])) * 1000

max by(pod, pod_ip) (
  last_over_time(kube_pod_info{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__interval])
)
or on()
(
  vector(0) unless on() last_over_time(kube_pod_info{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__interval])
)
$__to / 1000 - max by(pod) (max_over_time(container_start_time_seconds{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__interval]))
sum by(pod) (group by(pod, container) (last_over_time(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__rate_interval])))
time() - max by(pod) (avg_over_time(container_start_time_seconds{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__interval]))

sum by(pod) (group by(pod, container) (
    last_over_time(kube_pod_container_info{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval])
    or
    last_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_info{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", restart_policy="Always"}[$__rate_interval])
))
sum by(pod) (rate(kube_pod_container_status_restarts_total{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__rate_interval])) * $__interval_ms / 1000

panels.description: empty is containers in pod don't have cpu request

targets.expr:
sum by(pod) (
  # max by(pod, container) eliminates artifacts when pod UID changes
  max by(pod, container) (
    max_over_time(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", resource="cpu"}[$__interval])
    or
    (
      avg_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_resource_requests{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", resource="cpu"}[$__interval])
      and on(location, namespace, pod, uid, container)
      (max_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_status_running{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__interval]) == 1)
    )
  )
)

sum(
  # max by(pod, container) eliminates artifacts when pod UID changes
  max by(pod, container) (
    max_over_time(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", resource="cpu"}[$__interval])
    or
    (
      avg_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_resource_requests{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", resource="cpu"}[$__interval])
      and on(location, namespace, pod, uid, container)
      (max_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_status_running{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__interval]) == 1)
    )
  )
)
max(kube_resourcequota{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", type="hard", resource="requests.cpu"})

panels.title: container cpu request

panels.description: empty is containers in pod don't have cpu limit

sum by(pod) (
  # max by(pod, container) eliminates artifacts when pod UID changes
  max by(pod, container) (
    max_over_time(kube_pod_container_resource_limits{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", resource="cpu"}[$__interval])
    or
    (
      avg_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_resource_limits{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", resource="cpu"}[$__interval])
      and on(location, namespace, pod, uid, container)
      (max_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_status_running{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__interval]) == 1)
    )
  )

  # max by(pod, container) eliminates artifacts when pod UID changes
  max by(pod, container) (
    max_over_time(kube_pod_container_resource_limits{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", resource="cpu"}[$__interval])
    or
    (
      avg_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_resource_limits{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", resource="cpu"}[$__interval])
      and on(location, namespace, pod, uid, container)
      (max_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_status_running{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__interval]) == 1)
    )
  )
)
max(kube_resourcequota{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", type="hard", resource="limits.cpu"})

panels.title: container cpu limit

targets.expr: sum by(pod) (rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__rate_interval]))
sum(rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name", invalid=$total}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.description: clamped at 300%; empty if containers in pod don't have cpu request

targets.expr:
sum by(pod) (rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__rate_interval]))
/
sum by(pod) (
  # max by(pod, container) eliminates artifacts when pod UID changes
  max by(pod, container) (
    avg_over_time(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", resource="cpu"}[$__rate_interval]) != 0
    or
    (
      avg_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_resource_requests{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", resource="cpu"}[$__interval]) != 0
      and on(location, namespace, pod, uid, container)
      (max_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_status_running{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__interval]) == 1)
    )
  )
)

panels.title: total cpu usage / total request

panels.description: empty is containers in pod don't have cpu limit

targets.expr: sum by(pod) (rate(container_cpu_cfs_throttled_seconds_total{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: cpu throttled (average)

panels.description: empty if containers in pod don't have cpu limit

targets.expr:
max by(pod) (
  sum by(pod, container) (rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__rate_interval]))
  /
  avg by(pod, container) (
    avg_over_time(kube_pod_container_resource_limits{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", resource="cpu"}[$__rate_interval]) != 0
    or
    (
      avg_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_resource_limits{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", resource="cpu"}[$__interval]) != 0
      and on(location, namespace, pod, uid, container)
      (max_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_status_running{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__interval]) == 1)
    )
  )
)

panels.title: max(cpu usage / limit) %

panels.description: empty is containers in pod don't have memory request

sum by(pod) (
  # max by(pod, container) eliminates artifacts when pod UID changes
  max by(pod, container) (
    avg_over_time(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", resource="memory"}[$__interval])
    or

panels.description: empty is containers in pod don't have memory limit

targets.expr:
sum by(pod) (
  # max by(pod, container) eliminates artifacts when pod UID changes
  max by(pod, container) (
    max_over_time(kube_pod_container_resource_limits{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", resource="memory"}[$__interval])
    or

      and on(location, namespace, pod, uid, container)

    )
  )

sum(
  # max by(pod, container) eliminates artifacts when pod UID changes
  max by(pod, container) (
    max_over_time(kube_pod_container_resource_limits{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", resource="memory"}[$__interval])
    or
    (
      avg_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_resource_limits{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", resource="memory"}[$__interval])
      and on(location, namespace, pod, uid, container)
      (max_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_status_running{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__interval]) == 1)

panels.title: container memory limit

targets.expr:
# max by(pod, container) should fix overlapping data on container restarts
sum by(pod) (max by(pod, container) (
  avg_over_time(container_memory_rss{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__interval])
  or
  avg_over_time(container_memory_rss{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__rate_interval])
))

sum(max by(pod, container) (
  sum_over_time(container_memory_rss{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name", invalid=$total}[$__interval])
  / on(job, instance, node) group_left()
  count_over_time(up{location="$location", node=~"$pod_nodes", invalid=$total}[$__interval])
  or
  # I assuma that when __rate_interval is needed, the interval is short enough to not have issues with short-lived containers blowing up the average
  avg_over_time(container_memory_rss{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name", invalid=$total}[$__rate_interval])
))

panels.description: empty if containers in pod don't have memory request

targets.expr:
# max by(pod, container) should fix overlapping data on container restarts
sum by(pod) (
  max by(pod, container) (
    avg_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__interval])
    -
    avg_over_time(container_memory_cache{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__interval])
    or
    avg_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__rate_interval])
    -
    avg_over_time(container_memory_cache{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__rate_interval])
  )
)
/
sum by(pod) (
  # max by(pod, container) eliminates artifacts when pod UID changes
  max by(pod, container) (
    avg_over_time(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", resource="memory"}[$__interval])
    or
    (
      avg_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_resource_requests{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", resource="memory"}[$__interval])
      and on(location, namespace, pod, uid, container)
      (max_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_status_running{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__interval]) == 1)
    )
  )
)

panels.title: total rss + kernel / total request %

targets.expr:
# max by(pod, container) should fix overlapping data on container restarts
sum by(pod) (max by(pod, container) (
  avg_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__interval])
  -
  avg_over_time(container_memory_cache{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__interval])
  or
  avg_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__rate_interval])
  -
  avg_over_time(container_memory_cache{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__rate_interval])
))

sum(max by(pod, container) (
  (
    + sum_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name", invalid=$total}[$__interval])
    - sum_over_time(container_memory_cache{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name", invalid=$total}[$__interval])
  )
  / on(job, instance, node) group_left()
  count_over_time(up{location="$location", node=~"$pod_nodes", invalid=$total}[$__interval])
  or
  # I assuma that when __rate_interval is needed, the interval is short enough to not have issues with short-lived containers blowing up the average
  avg_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name", invalid=$total}[$__rate_interval])
  -
  avg_over_time(container_memory_cache{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name", invalid=$total}[$__rate_interval])
))

panels.description: empty if containers in pod don't have memory limit

targets.expr:
# max by(pod, container) should fix overlapping data on container restarts
max by(pod) (
  max by(pod, container) (
    (
      avg_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__interval])
      -
      avg_over_time(container_memory_cache{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__interval])
      or
      avg_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__rate_interval])
      -
      avg_over_time(container_memory_cache{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__rate_interval])
    )
    /
    (
      max_over_time(container_spec_memory_limit_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__interval]) != 0
      or
      max_over_time(container_spec_memory_limit_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__rate_interval]) != 0
    )
  )
)

panels.title: max(rss + kernel / limit %)

targets.expr:
# max by(pod, container) should fix overlapping data on container restarts
sum by(pod) (max by(pod, container) (
  avg_over_time(container_memory_working_set_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__interval])
  or
  avg_over_time(container_memory_working_set_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__rate_interval])
))

sum(max by(pod, container) (
  sum_over_time(container_memory_working_set_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name", invalid=$total}[$__interval])
  / on(job, instance, node) group_left()
  count_over_time(up{location="$location", node=~"$pod_nodes", invalid=$total}[$__interval])
  or
  # I assuma that when __rate_interval is needed, the interval is short enough to not have issues with short-lived containers blowing up the average
  avg_over_time(container_memory_working_set_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name", invalid=$total}[$__rate_interval])
))

/
sum by(pod) (

)

panels.title: total wss / total request

targets.expr:
# max by(pod, container) should fix overlapping data on container restarts
sum by(pod) (max by(pod, container) (
  avg_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__interval])

  sum_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name", invalid=$total}[$__interval])
  / on(job, instance, node) group_left()
  count_over_time(up{location="$location", node=~"$pod_nodes", invalid=$total}[$__interval])
  or
  # I assuma that when __rate_interval is needed, the interval is short enough to not have issues with short-lived containers blowing up the average
  avg_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name", invalid=$total}[$__rate_interval])
))

panels.description: empty if containers in pod don't have memory limit

targets.expr:
# max by(pod, container) should fix overlapping data on container restarts
max by(pod) (
  max by(pod, container) (
    (
      avg_over_time(container_memory_working_set_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__interval])
      or
      avg_over_time(container_memory_working_set_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__rate_interval])
    )
    /
    (
      (max_over_time(container_spec_memory_limit_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__interval]) != 0)
      or
      (max_over_time(container_spec_memory_limit_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__rate_interval]) != 0)
    )
  )
)

panels.title: max(wss / limit %)

targets.expr:
# if we try to use container ID, like with other graphs, query will fail because network statistics have pod sandbox ID
# we can't correlate sandbox ID with pod UID, so there is nothing we can do here
sum by(pod) (rate(container_network_receive_bytes_total{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval]))
sum(rate(container_network_receive_bytes_total{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", invalid=$total}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.description: Absolute values will change based on time scale, because it's showing total increase over an interval.

targets.expr:
# if we try to use container ID, like with other graphs, query will fail because network statistics have pod sandbox ID
# we can't correlate sandbox ID with pod UID, so there is nothing we can do here
sum by(pod) (rate(container_network_receive_bytes_total{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval])) * $__interval_ms / 1000
sum(rate(container_network_receive_bytes_total{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", invalid=$total}[$__rate_interval])) * $__interval_ms / 1000

panels.title: receive total

targets.expr: sum by(pod) (rate(container_network_transmit_bytes_total{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval]))
sum(rate(container_network_transmit_bytes_total{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", invalid=$total}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.description: Absolute values will change based on time scale, because it's showing total increase over an interval.

targets.expr:
# if we try to use container ID, like with other graphs, query will fail because network statistics have pod sandbox ID
# we can't correlate sandbox ID with pod UID, so there is nothing we can do here
sum by(pod) (rate(container_network_transmit_bytes_total{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval])) * $__interval_ms / 1000
sum(rate(container_network_transmit_bytes_total{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", invalid=$total}[$__rate_interval])) * $__interval_ms / 1000

panels.title: transmit total

options.content:
Read/write from NFS and SMB shares
will not be shown in the storage throughput.

Cadvisor exports data from cgroup io.stats,
which are only calculated for block devices.

targets.expr: sum by(pod) (rate(container_fs_reads_bytes_total{container!="", location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__rate_interval]))
sum by(pod) (rate(container_fs_reads_bytes_total{container!="", location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__rate_interval])) * $__interval_ms / 1000
sum by(pod) (rate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{container!="", location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__rate_interval]))
sum by(pod) (rate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{container!="", location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", name=~"$container_name"}[$__rate_interval])) * $__interval_ms / 1000
max by(pod) (avg_over_time(kube_summary_pod_ephemeral_storage_used_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__interval]))

sum(
  sum_over_time(kube_summary_pod_ephemeral_storage_used_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", invalid=$total}[$__interval])
  / on(job) group_left()
  sum by(job) (count_over_time(up{location="$location", job="kube-summary-exporter", invalid=$total}[$__interval]))
)

max by(pod) (avg_over_time(kube_summary_pod_ephemeral_storage_used_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__interval]))
-
sum by(pod) (avg_over_time(kube_summary_container_logs_used_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__interval]))

+ sum(
  sum_over_time(kube_summary_pod_ephemeral_storage_used_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", invalid=$total}[$__interval])
  / on(job) group_left()
  sum by(job) (count_over_time(up{location="$location", job="kube-summary-exporter", invalid=$total}[$__interval]))
)
- sum(
  sum_over_time(kube_summary_container_logs_used_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", container!="", invalid=$total}[$__interval])
  / on(job) group_left()
  sum by(job) (count_over_time(up{location="$location", job="kube-summary-exporter", invalid=$total}[$__interval]))
)
sum by(pod) (avg_over_time(kube_summary_container_logs_used_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", container!=""}[$__interval]))

sum(
  sum_over_time(kube_summary_container_logs_used_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", container!="", invalid=$total}[$__interval])
  / on(job) group_left()
  sum by(job) (count_over_time(up{location="$location", job="kube-summary-exporter", invalid=$total}[$__interval]))
)
sum by(pod) (avg_over_time(kube_summary_container_rootfs_used_bytes{container!="", location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__interval]))

sum(
  sum_over_time(kube_summary_container_rootfs_used_bytes{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", container!="", invalid=$total}[$__interval])
  / on(job) group_left()
  sum by(job) (count_over_time(up{location="$location", job="kube-summary-exporter", invalid=$total}[$__interval]))
)

panels.description: Absolute values will change based on time scale, because it's showing total increase over an interval.

targets.expr:
sum by(pod) (rate(kube_summary_container_logs_used_bytes{container!="", location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__rate_interval])) * $__interval_ms / 1000
-
# when logs are rotated, last 12M (decimal) seems to be kept, so we need to correct rate()
sum by(pod) (resets(kube_summary_container_logs_used_bytes{container!="", location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__rate_interval])) * 12000000

sum(rate(kube_summary_container_logs_used_bytes{container!="", location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid", invalid=$total}[$__rate_interval])) * $__interval_ms / 1000
-
sum(resets(kube_summary_container_logs_used_bytes{container!="", location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__rate_interval])) * 12000000

panels.title: logs written

targets.expr: max by(pod) (avg_over_time(ephemeral_storage_container_volume_usage{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__interval]))
sum(avg_over_time(ephemeral_storage_container_volume_usage{location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", invalid=$total}[$__interval]))

list.definition: query_result(group by(node) (max by(location, uid, node) (last_over_time(kube_pod_info{location="$location", namespace="$namespace"}[$__range])) * on(location, uid) group_left() max by(location, uid) (last_over_time(namespace_workload_pod:kube_pod_owner:relabel{location="$location",namespace="$namespace",workload=~"$workload"}[$__range]))))
list.label: Node
list.name: node_selector

query.query: query_result(group by(node) (max by(location, uid, node) (last_over_time(kube_pod_info{location="$location", namespace="$namespace"}[$__range])) * on(location, uid) group_left() max by(location, uid) (last_over_time(namespace_workload_pod:kube_pod_owner:relabel{location="$location",namespace="$namespace",workload=~"$workload"}[$__range]))))

list.definition: query_result(group by(pod) (last_over_time(        namespace_workload_pod:kube_pod_owner:relabel{location="$location",namespace="$namespace",workload=~"$workload", pod=~".*($pod_filter).*", pod!~"$pod_anti_filter"}[$__range]      )    * on (location, namespace, pod, uid) group_left ()      max by(location, namespace, pod, uid) (        last_over_time(kube_pod_container_status_ready{location="$location",namespace="$namespace"}[$__range])      )  * on (location, namespace, pod, uid) group_left (node)    max by(location, namespace, pod, uid, node) (      last_over_time(kube_pod_info{location="$location",namespace="$namespace",node=~"$node_selector"}[$__range])    )))
list.label: pod
list.name: pod

query.query: query_result(group by(pod) (last_over_time(        namespace_workload_pod:kube_pod_owner:relabel{location="$location",namespace="$namespace",workload=~"$workload", pod=~".*($pod_filter).*", pod!~"$pod_anti_filter"}[$__range]      )    * on (location, namespace, pod, uid) group_left ()      max by(location, namespace, pod, uid) (        last_over_time(kube_pod_container_status_ready{location="$location",namespace="$namespace"}[$__range])      )  * on (location, namespace, pod, uid) group_left (node)    max by(location, namespace, pod, uid, node) (      last_over_time(kube_pod_info{location="$location",namespace="$namespace",node=~"$node_selector"}[$__range])    )))

list.definition: query_result(group by(name) (  label_replace(    last_over_time(kube_pod_container_info{location="$location",namespace="$namespace",pod=~"$pod",uid=~"$pod_uid", container_id!=""}[$__range])    or    last_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_info{location="$location",namespace="$namespace",pod=~"$pod",uid=~"$pod_uid", container_id!="", restart_policy!="Always"}[$__range])    * on(location, namespace, pod, uid, container) group_left()    (max_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_status_running{location="$location",namespace="$namespace",pod=~"$pod",uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__range]) == 1)    or    last_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_info{location="$location",namespace="$namespace",pod=~"$pod",uid=~"$pod_uid", container_id!="", restart_policy="Always"}[$__range])    , "name", "$1", "container_id", "containerd://(.*)"  )))
list.description: this hidden variable is used to convert selected UID to container_ID, because cadvisor metrics don't have [reliable] UID on them
list.name: container_name

query.query: query_result(group by(name) (  label_replace(    last_over_time(kube_pod_container_info{location="$location",namespace="$namespace",pod=~"$pod",uid=~"$pod_uid", container_id!=""}[$__range])    or    last_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_info{location="$location",namespace="$namespace",pod=~"$pod",uid=~"$pod_uid", container_id!="", restart_policy!="Always"}[$__range])    * on(location, namespace, pod, uid, container) group_left()    (max_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_status_running{location="$location",namespace="$namespace",pod=~"$pod",uid=~"$pod_uid"}[$__range]) == 1)    or    last_over_time(kube_pod_init_container_info{location="$location",namespace="$namespace",pod=~"$pod",uid=~"$pod_uid", container_id!="", restart_policy="Always"}[$__range])    , "name", "$1", "container_id", "containerd://(.*)"  )))
